body:
--low-level-retries=99999999 is the problem, even 99999 overflows the value. 9999 seems to work, but isnt sufficient. It appears min low level wait set to 30m is an option, but that makes less fatal errors take forever.

I'd rather -1 for retries to be infinite.

It doesn't seem like the low level min wait is honored, and with 9999 retries it seems like it equates to 8 or 12 hours with the millisecond increase each time

with min wait set to 30m, it still only waits 16 seconds initially. 44 hours is sufficient for my immediate needs, but this behavior is unexpected. I can see a situation where 2 days of retrying is insufficient.

I think this should fix it - can you give it a go please?

[v1.58.0-beta.6000.5650c1aa3.fix-5994-compress-crash](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5994-compress-crash/v1.58.0-beta.6000.5650c1aa3.fix-5994-compress-crash/) on branch [fix-5994-compress-crash](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5994-compress-crash) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
Thank you for looking, I get a segmentation fault immediately, no debug output. Running linux amd64 version

Is there something I'm missing about using these Dev builds? I tried this build and get a segmentation fault as well
https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5993-s3-multipart/v1.58.0-beta.6000.81f9fcab6.fix-5993-s3-multipart/

The binaries should just work! Check you got the right architecture so `linux` and `amd64` should be OK for you. You must be using kernel 2.6.23 or later.

If it is still segfaulting then post the backtrace, or if you aren't getting a backtrace run it with `gdb rclone version` and when it crashes type `bt` and post the result.

Getting a similar problem so I'm not opening a new issue.

## Context
- `/slowpool` is a ~2Tb ZFS pool
- `gdrive_tachikoma` is a `compress` remote pointing to Google Drive

## Command
`rclone copy /slowpool gdrive_tachikoma_compress:slowpool -P --skip-links`

## Result
I ran the command 5 times already. Every time it fails after ~2 hours with a similar error message.

### Logs
```
 * synology-backups/tolkiâ€¦on/loading/Yuumi_0.jpg:100% /48.603Ki, 0/s, -panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x40 pc=0xb5cb46]

goroutine 80 [running]:
github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).putMetadata(0xc00076b000, {0x1e6bfb0, 0xc001a6a680}, 0x1e6bfb0, {0x7f1310355618, 0xc004c11440}, {0xc01ecad270, 0x1, 0x1}, 0xc00ae01c38)
        github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress/compress.go:629 +0x226
github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).putWithCustomFunctions(0xc00076b000, {0x1e6bfb0, 0xc001a6a680}, {0x1e30b20, 0xc0031b1698}, {0x7f1310355618, 0xc004c11440}, {0xc01ecad270, 0x1, 0x1}, ...)
        github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress/compress.go:658 +0x166
github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).Put(0xc00076b000, {0x1e6bfb0, 0xc001a6a680}, {0x1e30b00, 0xc00a64c400}, {0x7f1310355618, 0xc004c11440}, {0xc01ecad270, 0x1, 0x1})
        github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress/compress.go:687 +0x2bd
github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/operations.Copy({0x1e6bfb0, 0xc001a6a680}, {0x1e9ef98, 0xc00076b000}, {0x0, 0x0}, {0xc012d66780, 0x0}, {0x1e9fd98, 0xc004c11440})
        github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/operations/operations.go:472 +0x1a95
github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync.(*syncCopyMove).pairCopyOrMove(0xc000137000, {0x1e6bfb0, 0xc001a6a680}, 0x0, {0x1e9ef98
, 0xc00076b000}, 0x0, 0x0)
        github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync/sync.go:402 +0x1bb
created by github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync.(*syncCopyMove).startTransfers
        github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync/sync.go:429 +0x47
```
@mrtolkien can you try the binary I posted above as I think your problem is the same (the crash is on the same line of code anyway)?

Running it as we speak, will update you on the progress. It usually crashed after ~two hours:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8489650/155703492-0cf0ec1c-3a8a-4af9-8f12-563246472c43.png)
Still has not crashed 4 hours in, so it looks like that solved the issue! Will update in the morning to validate that the full upload went through, it still has ~4 hours to go.
Thanks! Let me know what happens and if it works, I'll merge the fix for 1.58

So it *did* crash, but for another reason I think. After 6h14m the system sent a KILLSIG to the process and shut it down, but I think it OS-related as there was no error message.

So it looks like the fix did fix the primary issue!

After investigating more, I think the issue *is* related to `rclone`.

When using the `compress` backend, memory usage increases linearly. When it inevitably reaches 100%, my machine crashes.

My full pipeline is compress -> encrypt -> gdrive.

After 1h30m, memory usage stands at 11Gb, 65% of system total:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8489650/155827760-127ee2d4-3d1f-461e-b690-3c85d9a2dd48.png)

Command is still the same:
`rclone copy /slowpool gdrive_tachikoma_compress:slowpool -P --skip-links`

After checking for the last 30 minutes, this has steadily climbed up. It looks like some form of memory leak.

Sorry, I ended up compressing the data using gzip in the data pipe before rclone. My upload is also impacted so I can't easily upload 750GB+ to test any more. Hopefully MrTolkien is able to provide relevant data.

I created another issue more specifically linked to the RAM usage issue:
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/6013#issuecomment-1053012484

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.58

We'll investigate the memory in the other issue!
